Utilities

Class ScreenManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • Utilities.ScreenManager

  • public class ScreenManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is made to manage a collection of screens and the switching between them.
    Since:
    04-12-19
    Author:
    RazMalka

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activate(java.lang.String scene)
      Switches to the required screen by changing the value of the root parent.
      void addScreen(java.lang.String name, javafx.scene.Scene scene)
      Adds a screen to the screen manager
      void clearScreenMap()
      Empties the Screen Map HashMap, should be called only upon log-out.

      Get current FX

      Get the Singleton's Instance

      This gets the primary stage

      This gets the screen map
      static void initialize(javafx.scene.Scene currentScene, javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage, java.lang.String FXMLName)
      Initialization of Screen Manager Singleton May be called only once.
      void normalizeAppearance()
      This function centers the current stage and normalizes the position, resizability and borders among all scenes.
      void removeScreen(java.lang.String scene)
      Removes a screen from the screen manager
      java.lang.Boolean sceneExists(java.lang.String fxml_name)
      Returns whether a specific scene exists.
      void switchScene(java.lang.String fxml_name)
      This static function switches between screens using the ScreenManager and fxml templates.
